text: There are some attempts at making SOAP work with python, but I haven't tested it much so I can't say if it is good or not.
Since I've asked this question, I've started using python-symmetric-jsonrpc.
It is quite good, can be used between python and non-python software and follow the JSON-RPC standard.
Edit : Another interesting jsonrpc framework is rpcbd
I used the stub generator and It worked properly.
The only problem I encountered is about doing SOAP throught HTTPS.
It serves up multiple web server protocols at once so you can offer more flexibility at the client side.
We are developing Versile Python (VPy), an implementation for python 2.6+ and 3.x of a new ORB/RPC framework.
Functional AGPL dev releases for review and testing are available.
VPy has native python capabilities similar to PyRo and RPyC via a general native objects layer (code example).
The product is designed for platform-independent remote object interaction for implementations of Versile Platform.
Full disclosure: I work for the company developing VPy.
